channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Residents above shops dump again, 24th February
item.description:
Broken cabinet just discarded into the street because those who live above the shops think this is acceptable behaviour. Clearing required but education is also required to say and tell them how to live

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunblane Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree leaning, 24th February
item.description:
Large tree on the plot of land behind yester road is leaning and resident is concerned may fall and cause damage to property JW
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yester Road, Elmstead, Greater London

item.title: Substance (concrete?) poured into roadside gulley, 24th February
item.description:
Roadside gulley (drain) not only has bits of wood with nails sticking out, but the content of the drain (2 foot down) is some kind of impenetrable substance. I fear some idiot may have poured concrete or similar down there

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downton Avenue, Streatham Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The manhole cover is collapsing, 24th February
item.description:
The manhole cover on the inside lane on the A2 Old Kent Road coast bound by the fire station SE1 5AA is collapsing. This has been repaired previously on numerous occasions but still keep collapsing. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tabard Street, Walworth, Greater London
